cards.definition: The magnitude of the force is the number that represents the strength of the force
A measure of how much matter is in an object
The distance an object travels per unit of time
Potential energy that depends on the height of an object above earth's surface

title: Thermodynamics
description: The study of the flow of energy through system

cards.definition: Ability to do work or move matter. It cannot be felt or observed, expect for light or heat
The study of the flow of energy through system
States that energy can be converted but not created nor destroyed, only transformed

title: Fluid Mechanics
description: A branch of mechanics that is concerned with the properties of liquids and gases

cards.definition: the SI unit of pressure; equivalent to N/m2
principle stating that the buoyant force exerted by a fluid on an immersed object is equal to the weight of the fluid the object displaces
principle stating that total energy for a confined ideal fluid flowing through a pipe is conserved at all locations within the pipe
